summary: This document is a notification from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida regarding Jeffrey Epstein's guilty plea in state court. It outlines the plea agreement, including his sentence and a key condition granting identified minor victims the right to proceed under federal statute 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255, as if Epstein had been federally convicted. The agreement requires the government to provide Epstein's attorneys with a list of victims it was prepared to name in an indictment.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea and Sentencing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty in Palm Beach County Circuit Court to state charges of felony solicitation of prostitution and procurement of minors for prostitution. He was sentenced to 12 months' imprisonment, followed by 6 months' imprisonment, then 12 months of community control.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to state charges of soliciting prostitution and procuring minors for prostitution on June 30, 2008.
The plea agreement resulted in a deferred federal prosecution, contingent on Epstein accepting a state sentence of 18 months' imprisonment plus 12 months of community control.
A critical condition of the agreement grants identified minor victims the right to seek restitution and damages under federal statute 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255, as if Epstein had been federally convicted.
The U.S. government agreed to provide Epstein's attorneys with a list of individuals it was prepared to name as victims in a federal indictment.
The document is initialed by Jeffrey Epstein and his attorney, Jack Goldberger, formalizing their agreement to these terms.
